posts.title: Age Detector Table
posts.excerpt: A mathematical mind trick to guess someone's age using binary logic and column identification.
posts.content:
This table helps you guess a person's age. Ask your friend to identify the columns that contain their age. Mentally add up the numbers at the top of those columns.

For example, if the age is 27, the relevant columns are 1, 2, 4, and 5. The numbers at the top of these columns are 1, 2, 8, and 16. Adding them gives 27, which is your friend's age.

Surprise them with the correct answer!

posts.title: Do You Want to be a Future-Ready Engineer?
posts.excerpt: Key takeaways from industry experts on preparing engineering graduates for the technology-driven future.
posts.content:
Here are the key takeaways from Aditi Jain, HR Leader in Talent Management and Development at Visionet Systems, Bangalore to help engineering graduates prepare for the future.

Technologies to prioritize in engineering programme:

It is essential to prioritize emerging technologies that are transforming industries worldwide. Key areas of focus include Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML), which are revolutionizing automation and decision-making processes. Digital Twins offer powerful tools for real-time simulation and monitoring, while Nanotechnology enables breakthroughs in materials science and healthcare. Advancements in Biotechnology and Biomedical Engineering are reshaping medical diagnostics and treatment methods.

The Internet of Things (IoT) is driving innovation in connected devices and smart systems, while Quantum Computing promises unprecedented computational power. 3D Printing is revolutionizing manufacturing with rapid prototyping and customization. Lastly, Immersive Technologies such as Augmented Reality (AR), Virtual Reality (VR) and Mixed Reality (MR) are creating new opportunities in education, training and entertainment. Incorporating these cutting-edge fields into engineering curriculum equips graduates with the knowledge and skills needed to excel in a technology-driven world.

Role of internships and industry academia collaboration:

To become a future-ready engineer, it is essential to focus on both technical expertise and holistic skill development. The gap in practical knowledge is crucial, as many graduates struggle to apply theoretical concepts effectively. Integrating real-world scenarios into learning and promoting hands-on experience through project-based activities and simulation labs can equip students with the practical skills needed for success. Internships play a pivotal role in preparing students for their future careers. They provide invaluable real-world experience, foster skill development, offer valuable industry insights and give students a competitive edge in the job market. Additionally, internships facilitate networking opportunities and significantly enhance resumes, making candidates more attractive to employers. By bridging the gap between academic learning and professional practice, internships serve as a critical stepping stone for students transitioning into the workforce.

Crucial skills & knowledge gaps among engineering graduates:

Despite being technically proficient, many engineering graduates struggle to effectively communicate and articulate their ideas to stakeholders, which can hinder their ability to present solutions, collaborate in teams, and build trust with clients and colleagues. This highlights the importance of developing strong communication and interpersonal skills to bridge the gap, enabling them to translate complex technical concepts into clear and impactful messages for diverse audiences.

In today's dynamic and multigenerational workplace, the development of cognitive and behavioural skills is equally essential. Key competencies such as collaboration, proactiveness, personal effectiveness, adaptability and the ability to articulate and persuade are critical for success. Graduates must also be flexible and capable of navigating change, allowing them to thrive in an ever-evolving professional environment. By fostering these skills, students are better equipped to meet the challenges of diverse work cultures and contribute meaningfully to the demands of a constantly changing world.

posts.title: ChatGPT vs Gemini vs Copilot
posts.excerpt: An in-depth comparison of the three leading AI chatbots and their capabilities for educational applications.
posts.content:
ChatGPT is the AI-powered chatbot that grasped so much attention and made GenAI the hot technology in the tech world during 2023. This AI-powered language model interprets user queries and acts as an interactive interface, facilitating seamless communication with its advanced capabilities. ChatGPT finds versatile applications across various domains, including generating content for emails, social media, blogs, summarizing texts, translating languages, coding, facilitating learning and education, developing virtual assistants, simulating scenarios for training purposes and many more. The chatbot market has been crowded with plenty of ChatGPT alternatives with new models coming out every day. More and more useful AI-powered chatbots will even sprout in the coming years with different use cases. The goal of all these chatbots is to understand what the end user is trying to say and formulate the appropriate response based on that.

Amidst the variant ChatGPT, three that stand out prominently are ChatGPT, Gemini and Copilot. Let's delve into each of this little bit elaborately.

ChatGPT:

OpenAI's ChatGPT is the original chatbot that started the AI trend. It challenges incorrect premises and admits the mistakes in the prompt. ChatGPT is used for generating text, brainstorming new ideas, providing explanations for complex problems, etc. It remembers what user said within each conversation, using it as context, provide more accurate output as it moves forward.

OpenAI added new capabilities to ChatGPT and just released GPT-4o. GPT-4o ('o' for 'omni') accepts input in any combination of text, audio, image, video and generates any combination of text, audio, and image outputs.

GPT-4o is a new multimodal model available to free and paying ChatGPT users. Rather than relying on three separate models to power its features — GPT-4 for text, DALL-E 3 for images and Whisper for voice – ChatGPT now uses GPT-4o to process and generate text, images, and sounds.

Pricing:
• Free (For individuals just getting started with ChatGPT) - access to GPT 3.5, Limited access to GPT 4o
• Plus (For individuals looking to amplify their productivity) - access to new features, GPT 3.5, GPT 4, GPT 4o, DALL E image generation at ₹1,670/month
• Team (For fast-moving teams looking to supercharge collaboration) - Higher message limits on GPT-4, GPT-4o and tools like DALL·E, browsing, data analysis and more at ₹2,088 per user/month annually and ₹2,506 per user/month monthly
• Enterprise (For innovative companies looking to scale securely) - Unlimited, high-speed access to GPT-4, GPT-4o and tools like DALL·E, browsing, data analysis, Admin controls, domain verification and analytics

Gemini (formerly Google Bard):

The Google Bard chatbot, now renamed Gemini, is Google's very own AI chatbot. It's perfect for integrating with user's Google account. Its browser extension is used to write emails, summarize files and brainstorm ideas. Gemini AI chatbot can recognize the attached video and summarize it in a few minutes.

Gemini is designed to integrate with all the Google's apps such as Drive, Gmail and Docs, so that AI-generated content can be bought to wherever user works. With this tool, user can create custom images for social media posts by entering a simple prompt.

Pricing:
• Gemini Nano for smartphones like the Google Pixel 8 Pro - the smallest but most elegant model, ensuring best performance on mobile devices
• Gemini Pro - behind the free version of Google Gemini, providing users with the best AI experience
• Gemini Ultra - the most powerful model integrated into Gemini Advanced at ₹1,670/month with complimentary two-month access

Copilot (formerly Microsoft's Bing Chat):

Microsoft Copilot is an AI assistant integrated into Microsoft 365 apps. Copilot rolled out to replace Cortana, Microsoft's AI-based virtual assistant developed that operates via text and voice commands. Copilot is a suitable choice, if user collaborate with teams that use Microsoft apps such as Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel. Copilot can be found in just everything that Microsoft does – Bing, Windows, OneDrive and it's also available in web app and mobile app form. Copilot chat is available in the sidebar of Microsoft Edge, Firefox, Safari, Chrome and it answers contextually.

Features:
• Integrated with all Microsoft products and services
• Includes free AI image generator, 'designer' to create any desired image
• Assist and generate formulas for Excel
• Features different conversational styles (balanced, creative, precise) to tailor the results user receive

Pricing:
• Free (For individuals) - access to foundation capabilities, web grounding, priority model access
• Copilot Pro (For individuals) - additional access to Priority model, Copilot in word-excel-outlook-powerpoint-OneNote @ ₹1,671/month for each user
• Copilot for Microsoft 365 (for organizations) - additional access to Teams, Graph grounding, Enterprise-Grade Data protection @ ₹2,506/month for each user with an annual commitment

Testing ChatGPT vs Gemini vs Copilot:

To assess which AI chatbot provides more precise responses, Maria Diaz used simple prompt to compare: 'I have 5 oranges today; I ate 3 oranges last week. How many oranges do I have left?'

The answer should be five, as the number of oranges I ate last week doesn't affect the number of oranges I have today. ChatGPT correctly answered 5 oranges, Gemini answered 2 (incorrect), and Copilot answered 5 (correct).

Each has unique strengths: ChatGPT for versatility, Gemini for Google ecosystem integration, and Copilot for Microsoft productivity tools.

posts.title: Homonyms - Challenging Vocabulary
posts.excerpt: Words that share the same spelling yet carry distinct meanings when used as verbs.
posts.content:
Words that share the same spelling and often sound similar, yet carry distinct meanings. Example – light, park, fly, stress, head and many more. Are you familiar with the definitions of the following words when they're employed as verbs?

Nail:
Connotation: To succeed in doing something well or effectively.
Precedent: She completely nailed him in the interview with her tough questions.

Foot:
Connotation: To pay a bill or expense, typically unwillingly often because you have no choice
Precedent: He had to foot the bill for the damages to the car

Foil:
Connotation: To prevent something from happening successfully
Precedent: The unexpected rain foiled our plans for a picnic in the park

Harbor:
Connotation: To give shelter to or hide someone, typically someone sought by the authorities
Precedent: The hotel manager refused to harbor any suspicions about the guest until evidence was presented.

Sentence:
Connotation: To declare a punishment for someone who has been found guilty of a crime
Precedent: The judge sentenced the defendant to five years in prison

Doctor:
Connotation: To alter, manipulate, or modify something in order to cheat or falsify
Precedent: He doctored the photograph to remove the background

Understanding these nuances enhances communication skills essential for technical professionals.

posts.title: Cutting-Edge Advances in Electric Mobility
posts.excerpt: Groundbreaking advancements in battery technology and charging infrastructure for electric vehicles.
posts.content:
Electric Vehicles have emerged as a more environmentally friendly option compared to traditional fossil-fuel-powered vehicles, offering a cleaner and greener mode of transportation. As society embraces sustainable mobility, groundbreaking advancements in battery technology and charging infrastructure are set to propel the widespread cuddle of electric vehicles, ushering in a new era of clean transportation. Let's dig into the various research and advancements that are going to reshape the future of Electric Vehicles.

Transforming Charging Infrastructure:

Charging Electric Vehicle isn't always easy. There aren't as many charging stations as there are petrol and gas stations, so you might need to plan ahead. It can take a long time, anywhere from 30 minutes to 12 hours, to fully charge your vehicle depending on its battery and the charging station's speed. To overcome this obstacle, Traditional petrol bunks have come forward to integrate EV charging points as part of their service.

Integration with renewable energy – Adding solar panels (onboard charging systems) to vehicles can help charge them, meaning you won't always need to rely on charging stations outside.

Breakthroughs in Vehicle Technology:

Regenerative braking systems capture kinetic energy when you brake, turning it into electricity to recharge vehicles batteries. This helps extend the driving range of electric vehicles.

Battery swapping offers a swift solution. Instead of waiting for a recharge, users can exchange depleted batteries for fully charged ones at specific stations. This reduces downtime, particularly beneficial for commercial fleet operators and long-distance travelers.

Advancements in Battery Technology:

Many Electric Vehicles (EVs) are currently out of reach for the average consumer due to high prices. However, if customers aren't willing to spend a lot of money upfront, they might choose to wait around five years until electric vehicles become more affordable compared to gas-powered ones. Historically, battery costs have made up a significant portion of the overall price of EVs. Ongoing research and development efforts have focused on reducing these costs through improvements in manufacturing processes and materials. To tackle these challenges, innovations like lightweight materials and enhanced battery designs are being explored.

Advancements in battery energy density have transformed the driving range of electric vehicles. With higher energy density, batteries can store more energy in a smaller space, allowing for longer driving ranges on a single charge.

To ensure long-lasting batteries, research is focusing on developing novel electrode materials and cell chemistries. These advancements aim to improve durability and lifespan, making electric vehicles even more attractive as long-term investments.

Conventional recharging methods often take a long time. Fast-charging batteries significantly reduce this time, making electric vehicles practical for everyday use.

In addition to lithium-ion batteries, researchers are exploring alternative chemistries such as sodium-ion batteries. These alternatives offer potential benefits including lower cost, improved safety, and reduced environmental impact.

Diversity in Global Markets:

To better connect with local consumers, manufacturers are designing electric vehicles tailored to meet regional needs and preferences. This involves fine-tuning vehicle design, range capabilities, and features to meet the specific demands of the market.

As these technologies continue to mature and become more accessible, electric vehicles are poised to play a crucial role in shaping the future of mobility. They will usher in a cleaner, greener, and more efficient era of transportation. With advancements in battery technology, vehicle design, and charging infrastructure, electric vehicles offer a sustainable solution to reduce carbon emissions and mitigate the environmental impact of transportation. Additionally, their adoption will contribute to reducing dependence on fossil fuels and improving air quality in urban areas. Overall, electric vehicles represent a transformative shift towards a more sustainable and environmentally friendly transportation system, paving the way for a brighter future for generations to come.

posts.title: Key Innovators Shaping the Landscape of Artificial Intelligence
posts.excerpt: TIME Magazine's TIME100 AI list spotlighting 100 individuals driving significant impact in AI.
posts.content:
On September 7, TIME Magazine unveiled its inaugural TIME100 AI list, spotlighting the 100 individuals driving significant impact and innovation in the field of artificial intelligence.

This list includes 43 CEOs, founders, and co-founders, such as Elon Musk from xAI, Sam Altman from OpenAI, Andrew Hopkins from Exscientia, Nancy Xu from Moonhub, Kate Kallot from Amini, Pelonomi Moiloa from Lelapa AI, Jack Clark from Anthropic, Raquel Urtasan from Waabi, Aidan Gomez from Cohere, and many others.

The TIME100 AI celebrates a diverse range of individuals, spanning from the youthful energy of 18-year-old Sneha Revanur, a driving force behind Encode Justice and advocate for ethical AI, to the seasoned wisdom of 76-year-old Geoffrey Hinton, affectionately dubbed the 'Godfather of AI', who departed from Google earlier this year to voice concerns about the potential hazards of the very technology he played a pivotal role in developing.

The compilation also highlights pioneers in AI from India or individuals of Indian descent, underscoring the significant contribution the nation is poised to make in the domain.

posts.title: Google Dorking
posts.author: G.Pavithran, I B.E AIML and K.Kiruthika, Technical Trainer
posts.excerpt: Advanced search techniques to uncover information on the internet using Google's search operators.
posts.content:
Google Dorking was founded by 'Jhonny Long' in December 2002.

Google Dorking also known as Google Hacking, is a technique that utilizes advanced search operators to uncover information on the internet that may not be readily available through standard search queries.

Uses of Google Dorking:

This strategy takes advantage of the features of Google's search algorithms to locate specific text strings within search results. Notably, while the term 'hacking' suggests an illicit activity, Google Dorking is entirely legal and often used by security professionals to identify vulnerabilities in their systems.

Working of dorks:

Google Dorks are advanced search queries that use Google's search operators to uncover sensitive information that is not intended to be publicly available, such as login pages, database information, and other sensitive data. This method can be used to find files of a particular type, search within a specific website, look for certain keywords in the title of a web page, or even find pages that link to a particular URL.

Types of Google Dorking, Advantages and Disadvantages are covered in detail in the WordPress article.

posts.title: Headphone Jack
posts.excerpt: Understanding the different types of audio jacks and their capabilities.
posts.content:
Most of you might have used headphone often. Have you noticed it's Pin? If not, this information is for you.

Universal audio jack size – 3.5 mm
Types – TS, TRS, TRRS

TS – Tip Sleeve Jack (Mono Jack): This type of jack doesn't support stereo sound (you will get same sound from left and right sides) and microphone.

TRS – Tip Ring Sleeve Jack (Stereo Jack): This type of jack supports stereo sound but doesn't supports microphone. TRS Jack can be used only to listen music but can't talk on calls.

TRRS – Tip Ring Ring Sleeve Jack (Microphone Jack): This type of jack it includes both stereo and microphone.
